column4: I have a blog in XML format, exported from blogger.com. how do i open it in ubuntu?
open it in gedit
it wont open correctly
i want it to be viewed as a blog or diary
if you're wanting it to look exactly like it looks in blogger, that won't happen
ok, then how can i do to continue my blogging in a new software?
you'll have to open it from your blogger.com page
see if blogger.com allows "export", and then use that to import it to new software
yes it allows export. that gets me the xml file
then see if the new software allows importing of xml files
do you know any good software for ubuntu which does that?
no, I use blogger.com because it's easy and I don't have to maintain any software for it, plus I can access my blogger.com account from anywhere in the world
yes thats true, my concern is i dont want others to read my notes
if you're wanting something like a wiki-style diary, then try tomboy or gnote.. it's like a desktop wiki
for personal diary, I simply use gedit and keep a folder of diary pages for each day
I c, maybe i do that. but it would be good if i could import all my entries somehow :/
Need diary software which can imprt XML-files
I wrote a small tutorial about daily journals/dairies: http://ardchoille42.blogspot.com/2009/08/how-to-daily-journal-with-panel.html
ty, seems a bit complicateed though :/
once it's all set up, the work is over and you only need to edit the journal. the work takes four minutes
there are other diary/journal apps in the repos. open a terminal and run:  apt-cache search diary
ok thank you very much :)
rednotebook is pretty good too
